name: Ten Hill Place Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Ten Hill Place for 4 days over the St Paddy's BH weekend. The Hotel is perfectly situated about 10-15mins away from Princes street, the castle and Grassmarket (though, the cobbles can be a bit trecherous in 4inch heels!) There are also plenty of restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Comfy stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room we had was on the second floor and very comfortable. We did however have an interconnecting door to the next rrom which, from past experience, I was a bit aprehensive of with regard to noise etc but we only heard from our neighbours once in the 4 days. And, yes, there was the frosted glass door which I would not be crazy about but it's only a minor issue.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — The big comfy bed with loads of fluffy pillows!
likes.disliked: — The dreary view from my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please be warned, the hotel bar and restaurant are very very very quite. I don't think I saw anyone in either in the whole 4 days we were there, besides breakfast, obviously!
reviews.title: Ten Hill was tip-top

likes.liked: — The bed! It was absolutely huge and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the room was comfortable, the staff were friendly and we had a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at Ten Hill Place for 2 nights at the beginning of March 2008. I had requested a quiet room and got a tiny room that was located as far away from the elevators as possible, which was good. The view was not, though, boring narrow street view.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a find!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service, sleek surroundings and a fantastic breakfast - all at a reasnable price.
reviews.title: Fab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a weekend stay this hotel is ideal only 10min walk from the royal mile and so the castle.
reviews.title: little treasure

likes.liked: — great big comfy beds with a huge plasma screen tv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We much prefer smaller hotels and so this was ideal.
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms
Poor european hotel in disguise
reviews.text: Would recommend this to anyone looking for a short stay hotel in Edinburgh.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. I booked a Superior Double Room for a one night business stay in Edinburgh and was not disappointed. These rooms have King Size beds, larger living area, with spacious bathrooms - that is what the website said, and it didn't disappoint.
reviews.title: Good value and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. It is central, albeit up a fairly long hill (hence the name). The hotel is well situated with a short walking distance to Princes St and all the sights and sounds. There are ample bus links, you are 10 mins walk from the train station and the immediate surrounding area has a plethora of shops, cafes, restaurants and chemists if you need anything urgently.
reviews.title: Ten Hill Place Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: 2. The hotel itself is clean, well appointed and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Awesome power shower - and a big bath. This makes a big difference after a long day.
reviews.title: A wonderful little find.

likes.liked: — Large rooms and nice flat screen tv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Ten Hill Place for 3 nights at beginning of October. The hotel was fantastic and we didn't encounter any problems whatsoever.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very clean, room was spacious as was the bathroom which had a fantastic powerful shower. The frosted door that so many have commented on wasn't an issue as it was situated as you enter the room and then the bed and seating area were around the corner from this so any other occupant in the room wouldn't be outside the bathroom door anyway as they'd have no reason to be!
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin!

likes.liked: — The comfy bed and black out curtains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was nice every morning, cereals, cooked breakfast, fruit, yogurts etc were provided. I only noticed that there was a selection of herbal teas provided on our last day otherwise I would have used these instead of the not-so-nice coffee I drank!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel was quiet, our room faced the front and you could hear a bit of traffic (especially early morning) but nothing that would pose a problem.
reviews.title: 10 Hill Place, Fabulous !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was great, 10 mins walk to Royal Mile, 15 to Princes Street but is just off a street (Nicolson Street) that has a great bus service into town should you need this.
reviews.title: Modern, central hotel
Fantastic!
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and i am amazed at what i got for £60. The location is excellence, £3.75 cab fare from waverly station, about 10 min walk to edinburgh castle. The hotel is modern and the room well appointed, with safe, lcd tv, iron and board, hair dryer, free internet if you use your own laptop. The breakfast was amazing, with black pudding ang haggis, quality bacon and sausages. Best hotel breakfast i have had in years. Stop looking and start booking, this place is unbelievable value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel at a great Price!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Price!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well what can I say we paid £75 per night for the room (which included a lovely breakfast). The hotel has a modern and very new decor (I think it's only a few years old), the rooms are really comfy; everything is clean and modern throughout(bed linen;towels;decor). As we were at the back of the hotel there wasn't much of a view, but this didn't matter as we were out all day.
reviews.title: What a place!!

likes.liked: — The bedrooms and communal areas were well appointed in a contempory style.
likes.disliked: — Nothing, even the weather was good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms have t.v's with some digital channels (no dvd player) and the usual hairdryer/safe/iron setup.
reviews.title: good value
excellent value for money
reviews.text: The bathroom is very modern but a bit unusual as the door is glass which isn't great for privacy and a bit awkward in the middle of the night as it will light up the whole room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Ten Hill Place for 2 nights on a first time visit to Edinburgh. The hotel is located near the University of Edinburgh and is a short walk from the Royal Mile and the other attractions.
reviews.title: Modern, clean, comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed in many "charming" B&B type accommodations while in the UK, but this modern hotel with its comfortable beds, modern bathroom (hot and cold water comes from one spout, yay!) with heated towel rack, and excellent breakfast buffet wins the "best stay" contest by a mile. Staff were very courteous in helping us store luggage, find public transportation, etc. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Great room, Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on business in Feb 2008. Had one of the skyline suites at a good rate. What a great room and what a great view over the rooftops of the city. This is a well located hotel with good rooms, free broadband, pleasant receptionists and a reasonable bar / breakfast
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Excellent find
reviews.text: 5 minutes walk south of the castle. Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ten Hill Place Hotel from 8-10th February 2008. The hotel is pretty central (less than 10 minutes walk to the Royal Mile, 5 minutes walk to the Grassmarket, 15 minutes to Princes Street).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not ask for much more
reviews.title: Great

likes.liked: — modern good price and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, Ten Hill Place is a pretty good hotel.
reviews.title: A good hotel but a few minor problems!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could be a problem for a few people, as it's an uphill walk from the city centre. If you're fine walking though it's not bad-about 15 minutes from Princes St and 10 from The Royal Mile.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The area around the hotel is very studenty and you'll find plenty of newsagents/internet cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean on the whole. The foyer was reasonably sized and the bar was colourful with a big widescreen tv. The staff were really friendly at all times and although we didn't eat, the food looked good and was well priced. The atmosphere was a bit lacking though and some music could have helped!
reviews.title: Value for money hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A real Gem. For £90 for the night this is a great hotel. We were very happy with our stay. The room was 1st class and much more than we expected. If you are looking for Travel Inn prices but much better rooms, you have to stay here.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Only downside is the price of the breakfast. Don't go for the £10 breakfast, there is a cafe around the corner that is great for £4.35 for full scottish brekkie!!
reviews.title: Nice surprise

likes.disliked: — The location, and the waiting staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the most striking things of this hotel is the difference between the outside building and reception area and the rooms. The outside and the reception, are pretty average, plain normal, boring nothing amazing, but the rooms are exquisite, lovely in size, really cosy and very tastefully decorated with nice soft furnishings and lovely bedding. It looks all new and and is really clean, an absolute delight.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Very nice stay
reviews.text: There are two reasons why I'm not giving this hotel a 5 star rating:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One is the neighbourhood, it is in the student area and there are not many decent restaurants around, just a few burger joints, a tired Italian and some takeaways.
reviews.title: a hidden gem

description: Ten Hill Place Hotel in Edinburgh - one of the capital's premier city centre hotels. From airy public places to each of our 77 smart bedrooms, the mood of Ten Hill Place Hotel is one of quiet sophistication, and one we believe sets us apart from other Edinburgh hotels. So if you are looking for an Edinburgh city centre hotel, be sure to make Ten Hill Place your first destination and an address we hope you will come back to again and again. During your stay why not visit our Café Bar which is located on the ground floor and is the perfect place to enjoy a meal at anytime? Enjoy friendly informal service whilst tempted by our extensive menu served from midday to 9.30 with a wide range of lights snacks and a la carte. We also serve our bar menu during the day with traditional tastes to savour. The bar displays a range of specially selected wines, beers, malt whiskies and spirits for you to sit and relax with. Ten Hill Place cares about the environment, and has a Gold Award for Green Tourism from VisitScotland.
